Name: Royal Colossal Head
Description: This head of a colossal statue depicts a king probably from the late Ramesside period wearing the White Crown of Upper Egypt. The nose, the ears and the top of the crown are broken. There are traces of the cosmetic eye lines and the eyebrows, done in high relief. The mouth is carved small with a gentle smile, as was usual in the depictions of the features of the late Ramesside sculptures. The head shows the king with the royal false beard attached to his chin.
